result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Richard Hilsgen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay court costs according to a schedule as set by Probation & Parole.
No contact with Cindy Hilsgren without written permission of Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 03-17-2015. Complete all hours by 07-01-2015 with minimum of 10 hours per month.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Richard Hilsgen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC that they received payment in full from Gary Hilsgren for his unpaid court obligations.  Hrg. cancelled for 12/14/15.

records.addlTxt:
Community Service Completion Report.
Obligations of community service completed as of 06-17-2015 as verified by C/S Coordinator.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary Richard Hilsgen
Current: PO Box 164, Bay City, WI 54723 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2015)
Prior: N2272 Cty Rd D, Bay City, WI 54723

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 03-17-2015. Complete all hours by 07-01-2015 with minimum of 10 hours per month.

Defendant Gary Richard Hilsgen in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.    Plea colloquy/plea questionnaire and waiver of rights given.   Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.    State complied with victim rights.  Victim impact statement filed.  State recommends 1 yr. probation with conditions:  no contact with C.H., 40 hrs. C/S, costs of case.  Court withholdings sentence and places defendant on 1 yr. probation with conditions.  Advised of appeal rights.
Defendant Gary Richard Hilsgen in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel, files waiver of right to attorney with court.

Defendant Gary Richard Hilsgen in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Notice provided to parties.
